Revival of the Empire

After the fall of the Rashtrakutas, Taila II revived the Chalukya dynasty in 973 AD. He shifted his capital from Manyakheta to Kalyani (modern Basavakalyan). This dynasty remained the most powerful empire in the Deccan for nearly two centuries, fiercely contending for supremacy in South India with the Cholas.

ЁЯСС
Vikramaditya VI: Golden Age

Vikramaditya VI (1076тАУ1126 CE) was the greatest emperor of this dynasty. He initiated the 'Vikram Samvat'. His court was filled with scholars; the famous Kashmiri poet Bilhana wrote 'Vikramankadevacharitam' on his life, and the jurist Vijnaneshwara composed 'Mitakshara' (a seminal work on Hindu law).

ЁЯПЫя╕П
Architecture

They developed the 'Gadag style' of architecture, which serves as a bridge between the Badami Chalukya and Hoysala styles. The Mahadeva Temple at Itagi is an excellent example.
